info.name: Rheumatic Fever Postman Collection v1.0
info.description:
**CHANGELOG**

**May 21 2024: v0.4.0 - RF phase 2 updates / tranche 1**

Definitional / seed resources

- Expanded seed **LeadProvidersGroup** `CareTeam` now includes all RF secondary prevention provider HPI orgs.
    

New example instances

- **diagnosis encounter,** created by a new step in the _Register Patient_ folder - demonstrates the new diagnosis summary items (D3-D10)
    

Updated example instances

- _Condition-SevereRfConditionExample_ - latest version illustrates
    
    - **date of diagnosis** (recordedDate)
        
    - **symptom status at diagnosis** (new extension)
        
    - **symptom onset date**
        
- _SecondaryProphylaxisCareTeam_ (Taranaki RF service now ref'd by correct HPI org Id)
    
- _SecondaryProphylaxisAppointment-September-Booked_ now reflects encounter to occur at shared care provider (Taranaki).
    
- _MedicationRequest-PlannedBenzathineMedicationWithLignocaine_ the planned medication in the careplan now shows planned medication with benzathine AND lignocaine for pain relief
    
- _Bundle-SecondaryProphylaxisAugustEncounterBundle_ now demonstrates lignocaine pain relief med using a contained MedicationStatement instance
    

**v0.4.0a** fixed missing identifier '_RheumaticFeverLeadProviderGroup'_ in canonical CareTeam instance

**June 21 2024: v0.4.3**

- Updated seed Questionnaires to match IGv0.4.3
    
- Updated all example instances to match IGv0.4.3 (EXCEPT for Consent instances which remain unchanged for now)
    

**August 8 2024: v0.4.7**

- Updated all seed resources and example instances per phase 2 updates and using the IG at its official published location [https://fhir-ig.digital.health.nz/rheumatic-fever/index.html](https://fhir-ig.digital.health.nz/rheumatic-fever/index.html)
    

**August 12 2024: v0.4.8**

- national system (rfccs) identifiers, as sliced in profiles, in example instances updated to align to forthcoming system namespace standard
    
- eSAM address id of patient's home address now uses the new standard system namespace uri.
    

**August 12 2024: v0.4.8a**

- fixed bug in Consent data.reference linking
    
- fixed update bug where SP appointment was being overwritten by dental appointment
    
- added canned queries to show retrieving RF instances by `_tag` and `_profile`
    
- updated XXX example that demonstrates 'other' relationshiptype
    

**September 20 2024: v1.0**

- All canonical Urls updated for the Implementation Guide published at the official location [https://fhir-ig.digital.health.nz/rheumatic-fever/index.html](https://fhir-ig.digital.health.nz/rheumatic-fever/index.html)
    
- Updated example Request-Context supplied in all API requests (root folder script)

item.description:
Definitional resources such as FHIR Questionnaires have to be seeded in DEV and TEST environments by the developer, because these environments are always sandboxes with resource visibility restricted to each FHIRWorks user (client id).

In UAT and PROD, the following definitional resource types are seeded automatically as part of environment deployment:

- `Questionnaire`
    
- `PlanDefinition`
    
- `ActivityDefinition`

item.description:
This creates a new service request based on an ActivityDefinition. Note that the service request is linked to the CarePlan. Subsequent Observation resources should be linked to this ServiceRequest.

All operations in this folder performed by the service requestor (e.g. CCCM)

This folder represents adding an optional activity to a COVID CarePlan.
